title: Fish: animal classes
brief_description: Learn all about fish in an entertaining way. This video explains that fish are the oldest vertebrate class on earth and that there are more than 24,000 species of them. It also describes the three categories of fish (primitive, bony and cartilaginous), as well as the anatomy of all fish including: gills, fins, skin and scales, cold- and warm-blooded types, swim bladders and lateral lines. Live-action footage illustrates the incredible variety and drama of life underwater. Also described are the little-known that ways in which fish smell, taste, see and hear. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.
